Webbsuccé DNA

The inner workings of a rather different consulting company

View project on GitHub

What is this?

This site is an open-source site describing how Webbsuccé works and why.

Webbsuccé is a web agency company based in Helsingborg, Sweden. But we aren’t a very typical web agency company. For example:

  • None of the consultants are actually employed by Webbsuccé.
  • We have no managers, not even a CEO. Instead we rely on self-organization and transparency. Almost everything is bottom-up, and anyone can drive any decision.
  • Webbsuccé’s main purpose is to enable consultants to be happy, and Webbsuccé Happiness Index is our driving metric. Strong revenue and delighted customers are a side effect, not a goal.
  • Webbsuccé doesn’t want to earn money from it’s consultants. It is in practice a non-profit company (although not formally so). Consultants keep most of what they earn.
  • Our ownership model is designed to keep our stock financially worthless. There is no incentive to “cash in”.
  • Consultants are 100% autonomous. They can do whatever they want (as long as they don’t hurt the brand or our house), and work as much or as little as they want.

We have been inspired of Crisp and the model of driving their company like a Teal Organization. We are so thankful that they shared the model in DNA – Open Source based. We have forked it and keep som really good things, and tweaked the other to fit our company and model open source it.

Want to start a similar org? See How to clone the Crisp / Webbsuccé DNA.

Contents

Driving principles

(these principles drive almost everything at Webbsuccé)

  • What is Webbsuccé – the purpose of the company
  • How Webbsuccé works – summary of our model, and some driving principles.
  • Why this works – why this model has served us so well

Core structure and practices

(although these are core to our model, they are mostly just consequences of the principles above)

  • Happiness index – how do we know if we are succeeding?
  • Ownership model – how do people become owners, and what ownership actually means?
  • Economic model – how does money flow through the system?
  • Value sharing – how we share the money
  • How we make decisions – how do decisions get made when there is no manager?
  • Recruiting – how do new people get in?
  • Communication – how do we collaborate, sync, and improve?
  • Bun protocol – how do we handle customer enquiries and route to the right consultant?
  • Cook-the-fudge Protocol – sometimes you just need to get it done – thats how we act!
  • Dashboard – how do we see the big picture?
  • Office team – how do we handle admin and day-to-day operations?
  • Board of directors – Swedish law requires that we have a BoD. So how does the BoD at Webbsuccé work?
  • Our business – what type of work we do
  • Customer support protocol and quality model – our business most important stuff
  • Sales – how do we actually sell consultants?
  • Webbsuccé unconference – how our bi-annual unconference works

Supporting practices

(relevant stuff, but not core to our model)

  • Industries that we avoid – why we avoid certain industries
  • Conflict handling – How do we make sure conflicts are constructive rather than destructive?
  • Contracts – our internal contracts for Webbsuccé membership, ownership, etc.
  • Brand building – how do we build the brand, both Webbsuccé and personal brands?
